The '''Exploration Update''' is the name for [[Java Edition 1.11]], a major update released on November 14, 2016.<ref name="1.11-pre1-blog">https://web.archive.org/web/20161114170041/http://www.mojang.com/2016/11/seek-out-the-exploration-update-111-on-pc-mac-now/</ref> The official name for the update, the ''Exploration Update'', was revealed on September 24, 2016, during the Opening Ceremony at [[MINECON 2016]].<ref>{{ytl|z27f6WkDWwk|MINECON 2016 Day 1 @ 2:32:27|Minecraft|September 24, 2016|t=2h32m27s}}</ref> During the "Casual Chat with Jens" panel at MINECON, he suggested that the name "Expedition Update" was more suitable to the theme of the update compared to the "Exploration Update".<ref>{{ytl|5b1kMBSb-tQ|MINECON 2016 Day 2 @ 4:31:22|Minecraft|September 25, 2016|t=4h31m22s}}</ref>

The main features of the update were announced on the second day of MINECON 2016, during "The Minecraft 1.11 Change Log" on September 25, 2016.<ref>{{ytl|Vm6oplvyyh0|MINECON 2016 The Minecraft 1.11 Change Log|Minecraft|September 25, 2016}}</ref> However, snapshots for the update initially began around two months prior to the reveal of the main features, with the features being added in a snapshot just a few days after MINECON. 

Mojang released the [[Java Edition 1.11-pre1|first (and only) pre-release]] for the Exploration Update on November 8, 2016.

; New [[block]]s
* [[File:Observer JE3.png|32px]] [[Observer]]
** Crafted using six [[cobblestone]], two [[redstone dust]]s, and a [[Nether quartz]].
** Used to give a redstone signal when it detects a block update.
* {{Animate|White Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Light Gray Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Gray Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Black Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Brown Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Red Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Orange Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Yellow Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Lime Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Green Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Cyan Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Light Blue Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Blue Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Purple Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Magenta Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png; Pink Shulker Box JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Shulker Box]]
** Crafted using a chest with two [[shulker shell]]s enclosed on top and at the bottom.
** Allows the player to access storage on the go by keeping any inventory it has when broken.
** Can be dyed to any of the available colors.

; New [[item]]s
* [[File:Shulker Shell JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Shulker Shell]]
** Obtained as drops from [[shulker]]s.
** Used to craft a [[shulker box]].
* [[File:Totem of Undying JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Totem of Undying]]
** Obtained as drops from [[evoker]]s.
** Holding it in the main hand or offhand resurrects the player upon being killed.
*** Absorption and Regeneration is granted upon activation.
*** Cannot prevent deaths when falling through the void.
* {{Animate|Woodland Explorer Map JE1 BE1.png; Ocean Explorer Map JE1 BE1.png|32px}} [[Explorer Map]]
** Obtained by trading with cartographer villagers.
** Used to locate [[ocean monument]]s (blue) or [[woodland mansion]]s (brown).
** The map shows the outline of land and where the location is and it is filled in as the player approaches the vicinity.

** [[File:Donkey Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Donkey Spawn Egg
** [[File:Elder Guardian Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Elder Guardian Spawn Egg
** [[File:Evoker Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Evoker Spawn Egg
** [[File:Husk Spawn Egg JE1 BE2.png|32px]] Husk Spawn Egg
** [[File:Llama Spawn Egg JE1 BE1.png|32px]] Llama Spawn Egg

; New [[mob]]s
* [[File:Creamy Llama Revision 1.png|32px]] [[Llama]]
** Spawns in extreme hills biomes.
** Attacks when provoked by a player or mob.
** Can be tamed similar to [[horse]]s, but does not permit the usage of a saddle to be able to ride them freely.
** Using a [[lead]] on a llama causes other nearby llamas to follow and form a caravan.
** Can be bred using [[hay bale]]s.
** Drops [[leather]] when killed.
* [[File:Evoker JE1 BE1.png|24px]] [[Evoker]]
** Found in [[woodland mansion]]s.
** Attacks any players and [[villager]]s nearby.
** Summons [[evoker#evoker fang|fang]]s and [[vex]] to deal with the player.
** When near a blue-dyed [[sheep]] in a 16-block radius, it converts their color into red.
** Drops [[emerald]]s and a [[totem of undying]] when killed.
* [[File:Vex JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[Vex]]
** Summoned by [[evoker]]s.
** Attacks any players and [[villager]]s nearby.
** Are able to phase through blocks to attack their opponents.
* [[File:Vindicator JE1 BE1.png|24px]] [[Vindicator]]
** Found in [[woodland mansion]]s.
** Attacks any players and [[villager]]s nearby.
*** Vindicators named "Johnny" or have the <code>Johnny</code> byte tag enabled become aggressive to all but other [[illager]]s.
** Primarily attacks using an [[iron axe]] that can disable [[shield]]s.
** Drops [[emerald]]s and rarely an [[iron axe]] when killed.
* 2 new [[villager]] professions:
** [[File:Librarian.png|24px]] [[Cartographer]]
*** A white-robed villager (librarian) that can sell [[explorer map]]s.
** [[File:Nitwit.png|24px]] [[Nitwit]]
*** Cannot trade with the player at all.

; New non-mob entities
* [[File:Evoker Fangs JE1 BE1.png|32px]] [[evoker#evoker fang|Evocation Fangs]]
** Summoned by [[evoker]]s.
** Causes {{health|6}} hearts of damage to players and mobs.
** Does not harm any [[illager]]s unless it was spawned by the player.

; New [[Generated structures|structures]]
* [[File:Woodland Mansion.png|32px]] [[Woodland mansion]]
** Found in [[roofed forest]]s.
** Consists of three floors that are procedurally-generated.
** [[Evoker]]s and [[vindicator]]s can be found here.

; New [[gameplay]]
* [[File:Enchanted Book.gif|32x32px]] [[Enchanting]]
** [[Curse of Vanishing]]
*** Items and armor pieces enchanted with Curse of Vanishing disappear upon the player using them getting killed.
** [[Curse of Binding]]
*** Armor pieces enchanted with Curse of Binding cause the player to be unable to take off the armor piece until its durability is gone or the player dies.
**** It's also possible to enchant items such as [[mob head]]s or [[carved pumpkin|pumpkins]] in which the only way to remove them is by dying.

; Other additions
* The command {{cmd|locate}}

== Further revisions ==
*[[Java Edition 1.11.1|1.11.1]] added [[iron nugget]]s and the [[Sweeping Edge]] enchantment, among numerous changes and bug fixes.
**[[Firework rocket]]s can now cause [[damage]] to [[entities]] that are within their [[explosion]] radius.
**[[Firework rocket]]s can now boost [[player]]s while flying with [[elytra]].
*[[Java Edition 1.11.2|1.11.2]] was released soon thereafter to fix a crash involving [[chicken jockey]]s.
